page.title: 14Farming-Conclusion.
page.content:
duck pond,surrounded by trees and shrubs. Mr.Trevor seems rather unsure about what the future may hold for the farming industry.He feels rather restricted by the arbitary decisions reached by governments and the common market,which are often made without consideration for the special needs of many rural areas.It is very difficult to envisage what the market requirements will be in 10 years time. Nevertheless,whichever way market trends alter in the future,Mr.Trevor feels he will be able to cope with the alterations necessary.The nature of his farm will allow him to change direction (in farming terms) without too many problems.
